title: Franchise Bold - similar font?
content:
Hi,

I'm seeking a similar font to [Franchise Bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20150312040615/http:/derekweathersbee.com/franchise/) - specifically with lowercase and scandinavian characters. Anything helps!

Thanks in advance,  
Candice
author: candice

comments.content:
Hi Candice,  
what do specifically like about Franchise, and what is the intended application?  
One option: [Garage Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20150312040615/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/garage-gothic/?testdrive=dock%3Dfalse%26size%3D72%26w%3D720%26src%3Dpangram.13%26text%3D%255BSwedish%255D%26fg%3D000000%26bg%3Dffffff%26goodies%3Dfit%26seed%3D32?refby=mfde).  
F

A couple of recent releases that might fit the bill:

Heroic Condensed  
 [http://typetrust.com/font/heroiccondensed](http://web.archive.org/web/20150312040615/http:/typetrust.com/font/heroiccondensed "http://typetrust.com/font/heroiccondensed")

Tungsten  
 [http://typography.com/fonts/font\_overview.php?productLineID=100035](http://web.archive.org/web/20150312040615/http:/typography.com/fonts/font_overview.php?productLineID=100035 "http://typography.com/fonts/font\_overview.php?productLineID=100035")

What I like about Franchise.. The subtle rounded corners, the condensed letters. I also like the distinctive s.

Garage Gothic is great, but it feels too retro I'm afraid. Bold is too thin and black is too thick, reminding me a bit of Poplar.

I'm seeking a font that will be used on posters and billboards.

Heroic is great. And I can't believe I forgot about Tungsten..! Thanks for the tip.

Any more suggestions that has slightly softer corners much appreciated too.
